title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
A federal appeals court granted Juul a temporary stay of the FDA's order for the company to pull its e-cigarettes off the U.S. market.

---

U.S. stocks surged, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow adding 3.1%, 3.3% and 2.7%, respectively. All three indexes notched gains for the week.

---

EY laid out more details of a plan to split up the firm in an internal webcast with partners this week.

---

Spirit Airlines said its board determined that a new, sweetened offer from Frontier is superior to an offer from JetBlue.

---

Cadillac plans to price a future electric sedan at around $300,000, according to people familiar with the matter.

---

Zendesk agreed to be acquired by a group of buyout firms for $10.2 billion.

---

Chevron is planning to sell its current headquarters in California and is offering to cover costs for some employees to relocate to Texas.

---

Crypto exchange FTX is in talks to acquire a stake in BlockFi, a crypto lender that FTX gave a $250 million credit line this week.

---

West Virginia Gov. Justice struck a deal to resolve debts that have hung over his business empire since the collapse of Greensill.
